meanings.definition: Disgusting or unpleasant in taste or smell.
meanings.sent1: The food looked so yuky that I couldn't even take a bite.
meanings.sent2: The garbage had a yuky smell that made everyone hold their noses.
meanings.sent3: The yuky smell coming from the old socks was enough to make anyone gag.
meanings.sent4: The pond water was so yuky, it seemed like a swamp from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The yuky taste of the medicine lingered in my mouth long after I swallowed it.

meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of disgust or revulsion.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie had some yuky scenes that made me cover my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The slimy texture of the slug was so yuky that I recoiled in disgust.
meanings.sent3: The prank they played on him was yuky, but we couldn't help but laugh.
meanings.sent4: The yuky feeling of betrayal lingered in her heart long after the argument.
meanings.sent5: The yuky sight of the spider crawling on the wall sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: Covered in or resembling something unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The dog came back from the mud puddle looking all yuky and dirty.
meanings.sent2: Her shoes were yuky with mud after walking through the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The yuky paint splatters on the wall made it look like a messy art project.
meanings.sent4: The yuky stains on the carpet resembled a map of spilled drinks.
meanings.sent5: The yuky appearance of the old house gave it a spooky, abandoned feel.
